Reviews.Title: “AYOR- At Your Own Risk -Very Dangerous Area”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a very nice and upscale neighborhood of Santurce, Puerto Rico, part of San Juan's Metropolitan area. Under ordinarily circumstances, I would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly. In the past few weeks, criminal activity has increased included countless muggings and armed robberies which occur both at night and during the day. The hotel does not have any security staff at all. You are totally on your own. Given the current crime wave in Puerto Rico, the local Police Force is helpless and does not possess the tools and/or financing necessary to properly patrol and police the streets. Therefore, since you cannot count on the police or hotel security staff to protect you, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE DO NOT walk outside of the hotel ALONE. Avoid this area at night entirely. In the past few weeks attacks have escalated. Entire families have been held up at gunpoint, as brazen robbers steal cellphones, car keys (and hence cars) wallets, purses, jewelry and other valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: PassionateTraveller3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night after a cruise and then 1 night after a week on the island of vieques. The hotel is close to the isla grande airport (domestic airport(the local one good flights to Vieques), san juan and also an easy place to get a bus to the old town (if you are a confident traveller). Also very cheap on bus about 50cents or 75 cents one way to the old town!!!!! for a 10 min journey. Cost about $10 or $15, dollars by taxi from the cruise terminal to get here about 10 mins journey. It is not really a hotel but a block of flats with a small reception area and a lift (no food provided or offered) My rooms did have a fridge. Very helpful receptionist. All very clean. On both nights I stayed here the room I was given was a big double with a balcony and big clean bathroom. It is not really top spec new, bathroom a bit dated but very solid with windows, but really clean, and not claustrophobic and quiet. This hotel is so much better value than most others I saw advertised. It is a good base from which to enjoy San Juan without paying ridiculous money. I booked via email - couldn't book direct by internet - had to phone up with credit card number. My first email wasn't really answered - better results by phoning. They are 5 hours behind UK. I liked the area of Miramar which this hotel is based in. It is a relaxed suburb where it is easy to walk to the bank, pharmacy, late night supermarket and restaurants and take aways. There is a good restaurant right next door to the Olimpo which I didn't have time to visit but didn't look too expensive and looked fun. I had a good manicure and pedicure on the main road at end of street that the Olimpo is on (it is a hairdressers) . Not expensive and all very puerto rican and fun. No english really spoken. For breakfast I also had a simple tasty breakfast with lovely egg on toast at cafe (green colour cafe) at end of street. It opens really early. Taxi journeys seem to cost $10 one way what ever you do locally which i thought was expensive.. As mentioned I took the cheap bus to old town instead. Reception can help out with bus times. They run late and I used to come back about 9pm and felt safe. The buses run very regularly. I loved the old town of san juan. Lots of good restaurants and cafes and bars and south american music and energy. Lots of shopping also - some good factory shops for top brands eg Coast bags, Croc shoes, Ralph Lauren and loads more. Really beautiful buildings. I got a ride to the international airport at the end of stay from the taxi rank outside the hotel which was good value. (can't remember exact amount!!!) One other thing to note when I was there end of April it was a bit cloudy rainy - there was a tropical storm for a few days - after that it was good. May is the start of the rainy season here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Fordie84
Reviews.Content: The rooms were simple but clean and with a lot of space. For a modest price we had a balcony with a view of the sea (even though there was also a large portion of car park in the view), a small fridge and microwave,a table and chairs to eat at, TV, plenty of space for clothes, a safe (though ours didnÂ´t work) and good airconditioning. The people at the reception were friendly and very helpful, and the area was quiet and felt quite safe. Overall, IÂ´d recommend this place if youÂ´re looking for somewhere cheap and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The best inexpensive choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: inasetec
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for a medical visit, and a friend recommend it to me. It was one of the most affordable priced hotel in the middle of Miramar, in San Juan, just between Ponce Ave. and Fernandez Junco Ave., with good transportation, good neighborhood, and good service. Don't expect any plus service like in a Resort, nor a Jacuzzi or gym, but if you need to travel on a budget, and find a clean, good place to sleep and take a shower, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great value at a great spot!!”
Reviews.Author: Anaition
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week. The price is perfect and it's location is great. The room, which was big & comfortable, included a microwave and a small fridge, which is great, because there's a supermarket at walking distance. There's also a movie theater, pharmacies, lot's of great places to eat, banks...Everything u need is at a walking distance. You can take public transportation (bus) for 50 cents and, in a couple of minutes, you're smack in the middle of Old San Juan. There are also lots of taxies, for those who don't want to take the bus, but it'll cost u $12. The hotel isn't modern-looking, but it's clean, comfortable, has fridge & microwave, the staff is friendly, the price is really great, the location is also great, the parking is free...It's a great affordable place I'd recommend to anyone who's looking to visit the Old San Juan area at a great price. There's no pool and (at least in our room) the view isn't all that great, but all that i've mentioned before make up for it, specially cuz you'll be hanging at San Juan most of the day! You can go to the top of the hotel for a spectacular view of El Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further.”
Reviews.Author: sjukyd65
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for budget accomodations in San Juan then look no further. Now don't expect, tropical swimming pools, gourmet restaurants, ammenities galore, or the beach at your doorstep, but what you can expect, is a very clean quiet comfortable room with air conditioning, a full private bath, an in room safe and cable TV with a helpful and freindly staff. To get to the resort areas, restaurants or the beach, you will need to take a taxi or the bus. However, location aside, this is what a budget hotel should be. Besides, the bus stop is only a half a block away and will take you anywhere in the San Juan Metro area cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently nice”
Reviews.Author: Dove28
Reviews.Content: Whenever me and my husband travel to puerto rico we stay at Olimpo Court. In short walking distances you have a 24/7 restaurant, dominoes, supermarket, pharmacy, shopping and your about 3 to 4 blocks from a theatre and bus rides away from the famous mall plaza las americas and many other exciting places. The rooms could have been a bit bigger but it makes up for how clean their keep and you usually don't spend much time there anyway, so many places to go. Norma and Jose are so helpful and pleasant they complete the package. The price is suitable for the deal. Were always satisfied at the end of our stay

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: soraya-marc
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Puerto Rico and I am very familiar with San Juan and the rest of the island. I knew this hotel was in an inconvenient location and I was also ready for a low budget accommodation. I choose this hotel because I had a late night flight and needed to sleep only for a few hours before driving to my next destination. After sending some e-mails asking for information and pointing out to my late night arrival, I gave the hotel my credit card number and personal information as requested. In one e-mail, the hotel manager reassured me, even though the hotel did not have a 24 hours reception desk, that they would leave my room key with the watchman. I called and e-mailed the hotel a couple of times as I was experiencing very poor communication and little response, up to finally, my reservation was completed. When I arrived to the hotel, located in a dark and isolated street, I was informed by the friendly and solitary watchman that the reception was closed and he was not expecting any guest. As I requested his help, he made a phone call and then informed me that my credit card did not work, so no reservation was made. I was never informed about this situation. To end my adventure, he told us that I was welcome to sit in a chair in the bare and simple lobby or search for another hotel. After some more talk, I noticed it was pass 4:30 A.M. so I decided to drive to my next destination where I did not have any problem with my reservation - as I never have had before my Olimpo Court shocking experience.

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm & value”
Reviews.Author: macwacks
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 (with 3 teenagers) was looking to find a decent place w/ good value, for our first night ever in PR. Found this place through TripAdviser & we found it met our expectations. In a very safe neighborhood w/ a staff that was attentive to our needs. We got two rooms w/ enough beds for all & slept comfortably. Rooms were basic, but clean & met our needs; ours had a small fridge, microwave & a balcony overlooking the harbor. Only thing missing was some coffee and fruit in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people and friendly”
Reviews.Author: josejr1962
Reviews.Content: my first time and for the price was a good experience , also the location was great the staff friendly and positve and helpfull thanks to Jose and Norma I would stay again the Resturant el Chayote was great , good food and very nice people on the staff . I enjoyed and my wife too , thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice, affordable price, good location.”
Reviews.Author: LESIUS_LENHADUS
Reviews.Content: For the prices I was seeing, this hotel had an affordable price, although I think Puerto Rico is an expensive place to go. But it worths. The city of San Juan is beautiful, modern and the historic part is conserved. So, I have seen some comments here in TripAdvisor and resolved to take a chance on this hotel. Actually it was more than I thought. The hotel is being renewed, so the main entrance and lobby are modern and new. The parking area is wide and safe. I was a little affraid about the pictures I have seen in internet, but everything was better than imagined. The room still needs to be reformed and renewed; instead, it is clean and spacious. The bathroom seemed to be renewed as it was looking a little bit more new than the room. The room decor is not that good. TV is old, but enough, as we spent more time out of the hotel. Concluding, I would stay there again. It was a good option for the prices used in San Juan. Staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bertman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olimpo Court Hotel on our way back from the BVI's. It's a nice hotel, a great value and very clean. The desk clerk who greeted us, Jose, was friendly and accommodating. We read about the restaurant attached to the hotel (El Chayotte) and wanted to eat there, but we were pretty casual after 10 days on a sailboat and didn't feel like dressing up. So we browsed the nearby restaurants and discovered the newly opened Lima Restaurant, which served superb Peruvian cuisine. I loved their take on skirt steak and the seafood ceviche was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very nice find”
Reviews.Author: kaatok
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay,staff very helpful and friendly.Clean nice upscale art decco look in the rooms.Small rooms ,but very much to our surprise,we loved the place.It is not in the best area.But lets get real,cops carry machine guns and wear bullet proof vests every where in San Juan.You can take a 50 cent bus ride into Old San Juan.We felt very safe here and there is a grocery 50 yards around the corner.We will stay here again the next time we travel to P.R.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: fresaykiwi
Reviews.Content: So, we were booked to stay in this hotel that a friend of my mum's said was absolutely amazing but when we got there it turned out to be a total dump. We said thanks but no thanks, and got back into the taxi we came in and started looking for another place to say. The driver recommended Olimpio Court. It was amazing. At first we thought it was because the other hotel was so dingy but no, it was really good. The room was always clean, the beds were comfy and I loved the view from the terrace. It was really homey and the staff was really friendly and nice. I remember one night the maintenance man helped me learn some Spanish strums on my guitar and taught me a 'bolero'. There was a supermarket down the road and so we stocked up on little things to keep us comforable like ice-cream, strawberries and frozen dinners which we would pop into the microwave. All in all, the four nights we spent there were a blast. Some days we just wanted to have a lie in... but everything was a 50 cent bus ride away... all the major malls and what nots. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option”
Reviews.Author: etb2102
Reviews.Content: After our flight back to the US was cancelled we needed to find a place to spend a few nights in San Juan until we could get back home. After being ripped off in old San Juan for the previous few days it was an absolute pleasure to come across the Olimpo Court Hotel. While the rooms are fairly basic they are exceptionally clean and with cable and AC it was a total bargain at $91 a night. They also have a great rooftop area with a view. It is easy to get to old San Juan and the airport by bus from the hotel, saving money on cabs. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful at all times. If you're on a budget and want somewhere clean and friendly to stay in San Juan then you should come here.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice experience at Olimpo Court”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom looked clean but there were a lot of bed bugs. We didn't have a very comfortable night, and the situation got worse as the rash incresaed over the next few days. We also didn't get a room with a microwave. The location isn't great, I would recommend to stay in Old San Juan instead (where we spent a couple of nights and loved it). The additional $20 or $30 for hotels in Old San Juan is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Olimpo and Chayote!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is great! It was in a residential area, so there wasnt much to do in the general vicinity, but a quick bus ride (50 cents!) can take u to old san juan, and its about a 20 minute walk, or 5 minute cab ride to a small lagoon beach in condado. The room we stayed in had a huge bed and a microwave (I wished I had a fridge instead). The room was clean, had a tv with tons of channels, and a decent sized bathroom. The only thing I didnt like was that the water pressure in the shower wasnt great. The staff was super friendly and helpful, they told us places to go, and gave helpful hits of places to avoid. There is also a WONDERFUL restaurant adjacent to the hotel, El Chayote. It is SUPER expensive, but worth it! I had the most tender and juicy veal chop ever, with a delish goat cheese risotto. The desert was also amazing. While Olimpo isnt the most glamourous hotel in the world, it was certainly worth every penny. I had a great stay there, and for the price and the people, I would definetly stay here again!
